alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:21PM CDT until April 13 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Nacogdoches County in eastern Texas... Shelby County in eastern Texas... Central Cherokee County in northeastern Texas... Southern Rusk County in northeastern Texas... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 1021 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain that continue to develop and move repeatedly across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since 8 pm. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nacogdoches, Rusk, Center, Alto, Tenaha, Timpson, Garrison, Joaquin, Wells, Trawick, Douglass, Sacul, Ponta, Forest, Morrill, Shelbyville, Maydelle, Cushing, Appleby and Mount Enterprise. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
